parameters.toolTip: Device where volume will be created
Authentication method for storage volume
Comma separated list of IPs or IQNs
Device where volume will be created
Authentication method for storage volume
Comma separated list of IPs or IQNs
Use the Host Name Template field to auto-generate host names at deployment time. If not selected, a unique host name will be requested when the template is deployed.

Template used to generate host names at deployment time. Must contain variables that will produce a unique host name. Allowed variables are ${num} (an auto-generated unique number), ${service_tag}, ${model}, ${vendor} and ${dns} (ASM-assigned static IP will be resolved to hostname by DNS lookup).
Location of OS image installation files
OS administrator password set on the installed OS

options.name: (GMT) Greenwich Mean Time: Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London
(GMT+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
(GMT+02:00) Helsinki, Kiev, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius

options.value: Transitional Islamic State of Afghanistan Standard Time
options.name: (GMT+04:30) Kabul
(GMT+08:00) Beijing, Chongqing, Hong Kong SAR, Urumqi
(UTC-04:00) Georgetown, La Paz, Manaus, San Juan
(UTC+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna
(UTC+02:00) Helsinki, Kyiv, Riga, Sofia, Tallinn, Vilnius

parameters.toolTip: For ESXi services multiple NTP servers may be used if addresses are separated by commas. Windows and Linux services do not support multiple NTP servers.

parameters.displayName: Configure local storage for VMware vSAN
parameters.toolTip: RAID controller will be put in the appropriate mode and automatically configured based on VMware vSAN best practices.

options.name: SD with RAID enabled for VMWare vSAN

parameters.toolTip: Method for server selection
Pool from which servers are selected during deployment
Select specific server from a drop-down list
If selected server fails, retry on another available server
Pool from which virtual identities are selected during deployment
Use the Host Name Template field to auto-generate host names at deployment time. If not selected, a unique host name will be requested when the template is deployed.

Template used to generate host names at deployment time. Must contain variables that will produce a unique host name. Allowed variables are ${num} (an auto-generated unique number), ${service_tag}, ${model}, ${vendor} and ${dns} (ASM-assigned static IP will be resolved to hostname by DNS lookup).
Location of OS image installation files
OS administrator password set on the installed OS

Use the Host Name Template field to auto-generate host names at deployment time. If not selected, a unique host name will be requested when the template is deployed.
Template used to generate host names at deployment time. Must contain variables that will produce a unique host name. Allowed variables are ${num} (an auto-generated unique number).
Location of OS image installation files
OS administrator password set on the installed OS
Memory size should be in multiples of 4
Networks associated with the VM
